description.text:
All guests must be age 21+ with valid identification, there are no exceptions.   
Follow us 
    
  
 
 
  exclusive invitation - one evening only 
Join us for a one evening only performance by the Stephane Wrembel Trio plus a juried panel of art for a dynamic skyline event. Admission is complimentary, space is limited.  Kindly RSVP.   
Venue Address: Gansevoort Park Avenue Penthouse 2 
420 Park Avenue South 
About Stephane Wrembel:
 
“A REVELATION” –Rolling Stone Magazine     "Intense and full of charisma." -The New York Times    "One the greatest guitar players I've ever seen ...and I don't say that lightly." –Relix Magazine    "[Wrembel embodies] a John Coltrane-ish search for a moment of musical nirvana..." -Variety     "A truly astonishing talent…" –All About Jazz 
 Composer Stephane Wrembel hits the road this winter – bringing his jaw dropping talent, palpable musical rapport with His Band, and vivid and textured compositions to life on theater stages along the east coast and Midwest.   Parisian born Wrembel – whose music embraces all styles and influence to create a truly signature sound – is being hailed as one of the world’s most dynamic and inspired players out there today. Wrembel is indeed a standout – not only for his undeniable skills but also for his unparalleled ability to create a unique and vivid listener experience. 
  


like our events? FOLLOW US for more NYC Invites to Private Cocktail, Charity and Art Events! 
   
Follow us

All guests must be age 21+ with valid identification, there are no exceptions.

exclusive invitation - one evening only

Join us for a one evening only performance by the Stephane Wrembel Trio plus a juried panel of art for a dynamic skyline event. Admission is complimentary, space is limited. Kindly RSVP.

Venue Address:
Gansevoort Park Avenue Penthouse 2

420 Park Avenue South

About Stephane Wrembel:
“A REVELATION” –Rolling Stone Magazine   

"Intense and full of charisma." -The New York Times 
 
"One the greatest guitar players I've ever seen ...and I don't say that lightly." –Relix Magazine 
 
"[Wrembel embodies] a John Coltrane-ish search for a moment of musical nirvana..." -Variety  
 
"A truly astonishing talent…" –All About Jazz 


Composer Stephane Wrembel hits the road this winter – bringing his jaw dropping talent, palpable musical rapport with His Band, and vivid and textured compositions to life on theater stages along the east coast and Midwest.

Parisian born Wrembel – whose music embraces all styles and influence to create a truly signature sound – is being hailed as one of the world’s most dynamic and inspired players out there today. Wrembel is indeed a standout – not only for his undeniable skills but also for his unparalleled ability to create a unique and vivid listener experience.

description.text:
Exclusive events in NYC  PLUS the causes you care about – right here, in The City you LOVE.
 

We find, curate, and create exclusive social event experiences: charity galas, rooftop brunches, sunset cocktails and live jazz, fashion events, art gallery openings and more.


We are passionate about bringing together fun, charitable, dynamic people in relaxed settings to connect, exchange ideas, and to share new experiences! Meet and mingle with old friends and new and experience The City you LOVE in new ways!

Membership is currently open and complimentary.  

Join us!  
Copyright 2009-2014

We are passionate about bringing together fun, charitable, dynamic people in relaxed settings to connect, exchange ideas, and to share new experiences! Meet and mingle with old friends and new and experience The City you LOVE in new ways!

Membership is currently open and complimentary.

Join us!

description.text: Anime North is Toronto's largest fan-run Japanese Animation convention. It is a three-day event from May 22-24, 2015 at the Toronto Congress Centre (650 Dixon Road), the International Plaza Hotel (655 Dixon Road) and the Toronto Airport Sheraton (801 Dixon Road)
description.html: Anime North is Toronto's largest fan-run Japanese Animation convention. It is a three-day event from May 22-24, 2015 at the Toronto Congress Centre (650 Dixon Road), the International Plaza Hotel (655 Dixon Road) and the Toronto Airport Sheraton (801 Dixon Road)

description.text: Anime North is Toronto's largest fan-run Japanese Animation convention. It is a three-day event next held May 22-24, 2015 at the Toronto Congress Centre and the International Plaza hotel across the street.
description.html: Anime North is Toronto's largest fan-run Japanese Animation convention. It is a three-day event next held May 22-24, 2015 at the Toronto Congress Centre and the International Plaza hotel across the street.

venue.name: Toronto Congress Centre / International Plaza Hotel

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - T-Shirt: S, M, L, XL
Anime North 2015 - TCC Food Voucher
ticket_classes.description: The TCC Food Voucher is good for a Burger/Fries/Pop combo at the TCC during Anime North.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Moonlight Ball
ticket_classes.description: The Moonlight Ball is a formal masquerade dance, with food and beverages served, taking place Friday, May 22, at 8PM in the Grand Ballroom, Marriott Toronto Airport Hotel, 901 Dixon Road. Note, you must also purchase an admission to Anime North to attend the Ball.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Lolita Fashion Tea Party
ticket_classes.description: Lolita Fashion Tea party on Sunday, May 24, 2pm in the Orchid Cafe, International Plaza hotel. Dress in your favourite coordinates and meet other lolitas and Japanese fashion aficionados over tea and sweets. This is a formal event and we require guests to wear gothic or lolita fashion.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Seating #1 - Sat, May 23, 5PM
ticket_classes.description: Enjoy custom-blended teas, tea snacks and entertainment with the dansou butlers of Cafe Nocturne. Radisson room, Radisson hotel. All Cafe Nocturne butlers played by women.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Seating #2 - Sat, May 23, 6:30PM
Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Seating #3 - Sat, May 23, 8PM
Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Saturday "After Dark" Seating - Sat, May 23, 10PM
ticket_classes.description: Special Saturday "After Dark" Cafe May 23rd at 10PM. All patrons must be 18+.  IDs will be checked.  No ID, no entry, no refunds. Radisson room, Radisson hotel. All Cafe Nocturne butlers played by women.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Sunday Seating #1 - Sun, May 24, 12PM
ticket_classes.description: Don't feel like getting up? Neither do we! Come have "breakfast in bed" with the sleepy boys of Cafe Nocturne. Special breakfast-themed food provided. Pajama party! Radisson room, Radisson hotel. All Cafe Nocturne butlers  played by women.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Cafe Nocturne Sunday Seating #2 - Sun, May 24, 1:30PM
Anime North 2015  - Workshop: Silicone mold making
ticket_classes.description: 3 hour workshop Friday evening, May 22nd, on how to make molds for resin casting with the help of the props-master from Fantastic Creations.

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Workshop: Resin casting for props and costumes
ticket_classes.description: 3 hour workshop Sat. morning, May 23rd, on how to work with and cast resin for jewels, weapons and other props

ticket_classes.name: Anime North 2015 - Workshop: Leather working and tooling
ticket_classes.description: 3 hour workshop Sun. Morning, May 24th, on how to cut and work leather from the props-master from Fantastic Creations

name.text: YPL Super Sicilian Buffet: Back in 2015!
name.html: YPL Super Sicilian Buffet: Back in 2015!

description.text:
Simply quote "YPL" at door for ALL YOU CAN EAT 
Join as for our PREMIER APERITIVO for 2015... We will have a SUPER SUPER Aperitif this year with PRESS coming to report on our event for the first time. 
Practice your ITALIAN &/or meet an INTERNATIONAL mix of people, make new friends, break up the Working week, Network & Socialise in a chilled & Friendly enviornment. 
Traditional International & Italian Cocktails ranging from Aperol Spritz, Campari Spritz, Bellini, Prosecco, Martini, Negroni, Negroni sbagliato + traditional Italian wines & off course, the Italians favourite beers, Birra Moretti and Moretti La Rossa!!!  We will be happy to offer you a wide selection of “stuzzichini” (Italian style finger food) to accompany your favourite drinks but also loads of our super tasty hot pizza coming straight from the oven!  Join us for some Italian Cocktails & delicious food on WEDNESDAY @ Arancina (Westbourne Grove) quoting "YPL" Aperitif Party at the door 
2 Hosts assisting with Introductions & an even guy to girl ratio... come solo or with friends :) 
  
IMPORTANT NOTES:  
1. Food will be served continuously, you only purchase 1 Cocktail to enjoy ALL YOU CAN EAT + After 930pm Sicilian Desserts will be served ;)  
2. On entry to the event you will be asked to leave your email address this is OPTIONAL & only needed if you wish to join the RESTAURANT mailing list. 
3. Ticket does NOT need to be printed, just register your name & quote YPL on entry. 
4. By registering for this event you will be added to the Young Professionals London mailing list for future event invites, we do NOT give your email address to 3rd parties & you can unsubscribe from the mailing list at anytime or alternatively email me afterwards for an instant unsubscribription.

We will be happy to offer you a wide selection of “stuzzichini” (Italian style finger food) to accompany your favourite drinks but also loads of our super tasty hot pizza coming straight from the oven!

Join us for some Italian Cocktails & delicious food on WEDNESDAY @ Arancina (Westbourne Grove) quoting "YPL" Aperitif Party at the door

2 Hosts assisting with Introductions & an even guy to girl ratio... come solo or with friends :)

IMPORTANT NOTES:

1. Food will be served continuously, you only purchase 1 Cocktail to enjoy ALL YOU CAN EAT + After 930pm Sicilian Desserts will be served ;)

3. Ticket does NOT need to be printed, just register your name & quote YPL on entry.

4. By registering for this event you will be added to the Young Professionals London mailing list for future event invites, we do NOT give your email address to 3rd parties & you can unsubscribe from the mailing list at anytime or alternatively email me afterwards for an instant unsubscribription.

description.text:
A Social Networking group with an International mix of Young Professionals interested in meeting other like minded people for friendship / networking / partying at exclusive Members Clubs, Lounges & Bars. Age range is 21+ for our Bar / Club events & photo id must be produced on demand. 
The main aim is to socialise / network in an environment where you can be heard over the music. Where coming solo to an event is not an issue as there will always be others happy to socialise with you. Our events can feature up to 5 co-hosts so you will always feel welcome no matter how big or small the event is.

Where coming solo to an event is not an issue as there will always be others happy to socialise with you. Our events can feature up to 5 co-hosts so you will always feel welcome no matter how big or small the event is.

description.text:
TICKET INFORMATION 

Once you purchase, you will receive an order confirmation email from Eventbrite on behalf of the Wayhome Music and Arts Festival. 
IMPORTANT: If you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder. If you still do not see your order confirmation, click here to access the Eventbrite help center. 
No barcoded admission tickets will be issued for Wayhome.  All admission ticket purchasers will receive their festival wristband by mail.
If you are having any other technical ticketing-related issues with your order, click here to contact Eventbrite. For general festival info, click here.
All wristbands will ship 2-3 weeks before the event.  Wristbands will be sent to the shipping address specified on your order.
Need to view or update your shipping address? Click here for instructions. You will be able to update your shipping address until June 19th, 2015. 
DO NOT tamper, stretch, cut or alter your wristband in any way
Altered wristbands will be invalid and the bearer will be subject to ejection.
Wristbands cannot be shared (i.e. different people use them on different days)
All sales final
No refunds or exchanges
Program is subject to change without notice
Prices are subject to change without notice
Wayhome is rain or shine

 
 

STILL HAVE QUESTIONS?


Please visit our FAQ page
description.html:
TICKET INFORMATION

  • Once you purchase, you will receive an order confirmation email from Eventbrite on behalf of the Wayhome Music and Arts Festival.
  • IMPORTANT: If you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder. If you still do not see your order confirmation, click here to access the Eventbrite help center.
  • No barcoded admission tickets will be issued for Wayhome. All admission ticket purchasers will receive their festival wristband by mail.
  • If you are having any other technical ticketing-related issues with your order, click here to contact Eventbrite. For general festival info, click here.
  • All wristbands will ship 2-3 weeks before the event. Wristbands will be sent to the shipping address specified on your order.
  • Need to view or update your shipping address? Click here for instructions. You will be able to update your shipping address until June 19th, 2015.
  • DO NOT tamper, stretch, cut or alter your wristband in any way
  • Altered wristbands will be invalid and the bearer will be subject to ejection.
  • Wristbands cannot be shared (i.e. different people use them on different days)
  • All sales final
  • No refunds or exchanges
  • Program is subject to change without notice
  • Prices are subject to change without notice
  • Wayhome is rain or shine

STILL HAVE QUESTIONS?
  • Please visit our FAQ page

description.text:
Anime Expo, also known as "AX", is the largest Japanese popular culture event in North America, and will be held at the Los Angeles convention center July 2nd - 5th, 2015.  
For the latest information, please visit our website at: Anime-Expo.org 
Reminders 
NAME CHANGE POLICY UPDATE : Due to the new registration system and updated security requirements, name changes on purchased registrations will no longer be permitted. Please make sure to have your full, legal name attached to any new registrations. 
Please bring your printed registration confirmation for each attendee along with valid photo IDs. You may also use your smartphone access your registration confirmation using Eventbrite's mobile app. 
The only child attendee package we provide is the 4-Day Child Pass for a fee (children 5 and under are free of charge but still need to be registered). Please purchase this for your child even if he or she is attending for just one day. 
All attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult in order to pick-up a badge. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by an adult at all times. 
With the exception of the South Hall registration area, you must wear your badge at all times inside the convention center. 
Registration Inquiries: https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/  General Inquiries: http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/ 
  
DID YOU REGISTER BEFORE 1/28/2015? 
The barcode that was sent when you first registered is no longer valid and will not be scannable. A new registration confirmation will be delivered to your email from Eventbrite. This confirmation can be presented at the Pre-Registration counter electronically (via Eventbrite App or QR code in the email) or printed. Please make sure to use this registration confirmation as it is the only barcode that will be valid at Badge Pick-Up.   This applies to registrants who purchased any of the following badges from 7/4/2014 -1/28/2015: 
• 4-Day Badge • Child Badge • Premier Fan Badge 
If you purchased a badge between 12/31/2014 - 1/28/2015 and would like to request a refund, you must contact animereg@cmrus.com to process this cancellation.    If you purchased a badge between 7/4/2014 – 12/30/2014, you do not meet the 30-day refund requirement but you may request a transfer to 2016. Please contact Eventbrite Customer Support. 
If you registered for Artist Alley between 7/4/2014-1/28/2015, you should receive an update from the Artist Alley team within February. Thank you very much for your patience! 
  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or age requirements to enter the event? 
A valid photo ID, as well as your registration confirmation email, containing the QR code, is required to be presented to staff in order to receive your badge. Acceptable forms of identification include: Driver’s License, School ID, Work ID, Passport, Military ID, etc. 
Please purchase a 4-Day Child Pass for your child even if he or she is attending for just one day. Children ages 5 & under are free of charge while there is a fee for children ages 6-12. You must purchase an General Pass along with any Child Passes. 
All attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult in order to pick-up a badge. All children under the age of 15 must be accompanied by an adult for the duration of their time at the event. 
Any programming designated 18+ will require attendees to show a valid photo ID in order to gain admittance. 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Parking is available at the Los Angeles Convention Center. There are many public parking lots available in the surrounding area. Shuttle service will also be available for participating hotels. Please visit our website for updated information. 
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
Click here for our Code of Conduct. 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Registration Inquiries: https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/ 
General Inquiries: http://www.anime-expo.org/contact-us/ 
  
What is the refund and transfer policy? 
Your refund request must be received within 30 days of your registration purchase date. After 30 days, you may request for a transfer once, good only for the following year.  
Due to the new registration system and updated security requirements, name changes on purchased registrations will no longer be permitted. Please make sure to have your full, legal name attached to any new registrations. 
Any requests for a cancellation or a transfer must be submitted in writing by June 23, 2015. This applies only to requests from Anime Expo 2015; requests from prior expos will not be accepted. 
  
Can I update my registration information?  
Please contact Eventbrite Customer Support: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/
(800) 350-8850

   
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Please bring your printed to ticket for each attendee to the event in order pick up your badge. 
  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?  
Your registration must match the attendee. Each attendee must bring their photo I.D. 
  
Los Angeles Convention Center 1201 South Figueroa Street  Los Angeles, CA 90015 
  
Pre-Registration Badge Pick-Up Hours 
Day 0: Wednesday, July 1st 12 PM ~ 11:59 PM Day 1: Thursday, July 2nd 12 AM ~ 8 PM Day 2: Friday, July 3rd 8 AM ~ 6 PM Day 3: Saturday, July 4th 8 AM ~ 6 PM Day 4: Sunday, July 5th 8 AM ~ 2 PM

Los Angeles Convention Center
1201 South Figueroa Street
Los Angeles, CA 90015

Day 0: Wednesday, July 1st 12 PM ~ 11:59 PM

description.text:
Founded in 1992, the Society for the Promotion of Japanese Animation (SPJA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to popularizing the unique and deep culture that surrounds of Japanese animation.
The SPJA is passionate about Japanese Animation, manga, and their related interests, and works hard to make our projects reflect that passion. Our goal is to make our projects a place that brings together fans, industry, and all other stakeholders to share, celebrate, promote, and educate Japanese animation, manga, and their related interests.
The Society for the Promotion of Japanese Animation is a 501(c)(6) registered non-profit mutual benefit trade organization.

Our goal is to make our projects a place that brings together fans, industry, and all other stakeholders to share, celebrate, promote, and educate Japanese animation, manga, and their related interests.

The Society for the Promotion of Japanese Animation is a 501(c)(6) registered non-profit mutual benefit trade organization.

organizer.name: Society for the Promotion of Japanese Animation (SPJA)

ticket_classes.name: 4-Day General Pass (ages 13+)
ticket_classes.description:
Access to Exhibit Hall, Entertainment Hall, panels, workshops and more.
Does not include ticketed events (i.e. Concerts, Masquerade, Maid Cafe)

ticket_classes.name: Child Pass (ages 6-12)
ticket_classes.description:
Child Passes  are valid for ages 6-12 and give access for all 4-Days.
All children 12 and under must have an adult present for the duration of the event. 
Does not include ticketed events (i.e. Concerts, Masquerade, Maid Cafe). This badge type is good for access to Exhibit Hall, Entertainment Hall, panels, workshops and more.

ticket_classes.name: Child Pass (ages 5 & under)
ticket_classes.description:
All Child Passes give access for all 4-Days.
Valid for ages 0-5.  All children 12 and under must have an adult present for the duration of the event.
Access to Exhibit Hall, Entertainment Hall, panels, and more.
Must be purchased together with a regular 4-day badge
This badge type is good for access to: Exhibit Hall, Entertainment Hall, panels, workshops and more.

description.text:
3 AMAZING DAYS OF MUSIC ON THE BEACH!  
May 15-17, 2015, Gulf Shores, AL 
www.hangoutmusicfest.com  
We just added Sam Smith, Tove Lo, Sylvan Esso, Joey Bada$$, Deap Vally, Jef the Brotherhood, Natural Child, Floating Action, firekid, SNBRN and Elliot Root the the 2015 lineup. 
Also playing the beach at Hangout Music Festival: 
Foo Fighters   Sam Smith   Zac Brown Band  Beck   Skrillex   My Morning Jacket   Foster the People   Paramore   Spoon   Umphrey's McGee   Major Lazer   TV On The Radio   Phantogram Tove Lo 
Click here to see the full lineup. 
 
TICKET INFORMATION 

Once you purchase, you will receive an order confirmation email from Eventbrite on behalf of the Hangout Music Festival. 
IMPORTANT: If you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder. If you still do not see your order confirmation, click here to access the Eventbrite help center. 
No barcoded tickets will be issued for this event, all ticket-purchasers will receive a festival wristband by mail.
If you are having any other technical ticketing-related issues with your order, click here to contact Eventbrite. For general festival info, click here.
All wristbands will ship in April 2015. Please allow to the end of April for your wristbands to arrive. Wristbands will be sent to the shipping address specified on your order. All international orders will be held at will call.
Need to view or update your shipping address? Click here for instructions. You will be able to update your shipping address until March 30, 2015.
Need to view or update your shuttle line? Click here for instructions. You will be able to update your shuttle line until Feb 15, 2015. If you do not choose a shuttle line by that date, you will receive a West Shuttle Line pass.
All sales final. No refunds or exchanges.
Event is rain or shine.
You must be 18 years or older to attend unless accompanied by a parent or guardian.
Artists and schedule subject to change.

  
 
____________________________________________ By purchasing this ticket you accept the terms and conditions. Click here for terms and conditions.

  • IMPORTANT: If you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder. If you still do not see your order confirmation, click here to access the Eventbrite help center.
  • No barcoded tickets will be issued for this event, all ticket-purchasers will receive a festival wristband by mail.
  • If you are having any other technical ticketing-related issues with your order, click here to contact Eventbrite. For general festival info, click here.
  • All wristbands will ship in April 2015. Please allow to the end of April for your wristbands to arrive. Wristbands will be sent to the shipping address specified on your order. All international orders will be held at will call.

description.text:
The San Francisco Flower & Garden Show 
March 18-22, 2015  San Mateo Event Center. 
General admission tickets include admission to view all gardens, displays, vendors and exhibits as well as your choice of scheduled speaker seminars and demonstrations.  
Single day tickets can be used any (one) day of the show. Show tickets aren’t date specific.   Tickets can be bought at local nurseries see the Show website.  PLEASE READ EACH TICKET TYPE CAREFULLY.  ALL PURCHASES ARE FINAL. NO REFUNDS.  

SPECIAL FLORAL PROGRAM TICKETS...    at a special additional fee  
Floral Design Demonstrations & Workshops on the International Stage Click here  
 
Occasion! of Carmel California has been bringing the top world-class floral designers to the US for over a decade. This year Occasion is proud to offer their special programs with a world-class flair to the workshops and stages of the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show. 
For more information and to purchase International Floral Design program tickets, visit the Occasion! website.  

  
TICKET FAQs 
If you have a trouble printing your ticket, or any other problem related to this ticketing website, please contact Eventbrite support at support@eventbrite.com  or call 1-800-350-8850 
Q&A 
How do I get my tickets once I have purchased them online Tickets purchased on-line, will receive an email confirmation with a link to print your eTickets from your computer.  
I did not receive an email confirmation when I ordered my tickets, what should I do? Check your spam or gray mail folder, in case it was misdirected. If you are unable to find it, email support@eventbrite.com to have it resent. Please include the name and email address used to order the tickets.  
I am not able to print my tickets, what should I do? The ticket is in PDF format. It may not print from the "PRINT" command in your menu bar. It may print from the disappearig print icon near  the bottom of the front of the ticket. Adobe has a site which reviews the common issues with printing .pdf files       http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/873/cpsid_87346.html If you are still having problems, contact Eventbrite support staff at  support@eventbrite.com or call 1-800-350-8850. 
Are there extra fees for activities when I get to the show? Demonstrations, seminars and activities are free with the price of admission with the exception of a few special programs listed as “Special Events” which will be specially priced as listed. Hands-on workshops that include materials may incur a nominal materials fee for hands-on participation.  
The tickets have my name but I want to give them as a gift, donate, etc., can the be used by someone else? Yes, the single-day tickets are transferrable. The name on the ticket does not need to be the ticket holder at the gate. If you would like to have the name on the ticket changed or removed, please contact support@eventbrite.com, we can update the tickets on your behalf.  
Can the Single Day Ticket be used for either day?  Yes, the 2015 Single Day Ticket can be used for San Francisco Flower & Garden Show on any day, March 18 through March 22, 2015. 
Do Show tickets allow multiple entries over a few days?  The Early Bird Adult and General Adult tickets are only good for one day of the Show. You can purchase an All-Show Pass that will admit you all 5 days. Adult tickets can be upgraded at the door for the All-Show Pass for $15. Youth 16 years of age and under are FREE!   
Can the Multi-day Pass be shared between attendees?  No, the Multi-day Pass cannot be shared. 
Are there in/out privileges at the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show? Yes, attendees can come in and out of the Show. They will need to get a stamp at the exit gate before leaving if they want to come back the same day. 
What are the hours of the Show? 10:00 am to 7:00 pm Wednesday thru Saturday 10:00 am to 6:00 pm Sunday 
Is the San Mateo Event Center accessible to disabled persons? Are there wheelchairs available? Where is parking for disabled persons? The San Mateo Event Center in California is accessible to disabled persons with parking available in the main lot (the parking attendants will direct you). The show does have wheelchairs (first come, first served) available at the Information Booth at the East Gate. 
Keep in mind that it can be difficult to navigate through the show during peak hours, 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. and on weekend days.   
How can I get more information about attending or exhibiting at the Show? See the show website at www.sfgardenshow.com  

Enjoy the Show!
description.html:
The San Francisco Flower & Garden Show

March 18-22, 2015
San Mateo Event Center.

General admission tickets include admission to view all gardens, displays, vendors and exhibits as well as your choice of scheduled speaker seminars and demonstrations.

Single day tickets can be used any (one) day of the show. Show tickets aren’t date specific. 
Tickets can be bought at local nurseries see the Show website.
PLEASE READ EACH TICKET TYPE CAREFULLY.  ALL PURCHASES ARE FINAL. NO REFUNDS.

SPECIAL FLORAL PROGRAM TICKETS...
at a special additional fee

Floral Design Demonstrations & Workshops on the International Stage
Click here

Occasion! of Carmel California has been bringing the top world-class floral designers to the US for over a decade. This year Occasion is proud to offer their special programs with a world-class flair to the workshops and stages of the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show.

For more information and to purchase International Floral Design program tickets, visit the Occasion! website.


TICKET FAQs

If you have a trouble printing your ticket, or any other problem related to this ticketing website, please contact Eventbrite support at
support@eventbrite.com or call 1-800-350-8850

Q&A

How do I get my tickets once I have purchased them online
Tickets purchased on-line, will receive an email confirmation with a link to print your eTickets from your computer.

I did not receive an email confirmation when I ordered my tickets, what should I do?
Check your spam or gray mail folder, in case it was misdirected. If you are unable to find it, email support@eventbrite.com to have it resent. Please include the name and email address used to order the tickets.

I am not able to print my tickets, what should I do?
The ticket is in PDF format. It may not print from the "PRINT" command in your menu bar. It may print from the disappearig print icon near the bottom of the front of the ticket. Adobe has a site which reviews the common issues with printing .pdf files   http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/873/cpsid_87346.html
If you are still having problems, contact Eventbrite support staff at support@eventbrite.com or call 1-800-350-8850.

Are there extra fees for activities when I get to the show?
Demonstrations, seminars and activities are free with the price of admission with the exception of a few special programs listed as “Special Events” which will be specially priced as listed. Hands-on workshops that include materials may incur a nominal materials fee for hands-on participation.

The tickets have my name but I want to give them as a gift, donate, etc., can the be used by someone else?
Yes, the single-day tickets are transferrable. The name on the ticket does not need to be the ticket holder at the gate. If you would like to have the name on the ticket changed or removed, please contact support@eventbrite.com, we can update the tickets on your behalf.

Can the Single Day Ticket be used for either day?
Yes, the 2015 Single Day Ticket can be used for San Francisco Flower & Garden Show on any day, March 18 through March 22, 2015.

Do Show tickets allow multiple entries over a few days?
The Early Bird Adult and General Adult tickets are only good for one day of the Show. You can purchase an All-Show Pass that will admit you all 5 days. Adult tickets can be upgraded at the door for the All-Show Pass for $15. Youth 16 years of age and under are FREE!

Can the Multi-day Pass be shared between attendees?
No, the Multi-day Pass cannot be shared.

Are there in/out privileges at the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show?
Yes, attendees can come in and out of the Show. They will need to get a stamp at the exit gate before leaving if they want to come back the same day.

What are the hours of the Show?
10:00 am to 7:00 pm Wednesday thru Saturday
10:00 am to 6:00 pm Sunday

Is the San Mateo Event Center accessible to disabled persons? Are there wheelchairs available? Where is parking for disabled persons?
The San Mateo Event Center in California is accessible to disabled persons with parking available in the main lot (the parking attendants will direct you). The show does have wheelchairs (first come, first served) available at the Information Booth at the East Gate.

Keep in mind that it can be difficult to navigate through the show during peak hours, 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. and on weekend days.

How can I get more information about attending or exhibiting at the Show?
See the show website at www.sfgardenshow.com

Enjoy the Show!

description.text: Always at the forefront, the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show has been considered a world-class leader in garden innovation, solidly positioned at the pinnacle of excellence since 1987. The staff of the newly re-created show are dedicated to upholding that tradition.
description.html: Always at the forefront, the San Francisco Flower & Garden Show has been considered a world-class leader in garden innovation, solidly positioned at the pinnacle of excellence since 1987. The staff of the newly re-created show are dedicated to upholding that tradition.

ticket_classes.name: OPENING NIGHT PARTY: National Wildlife Federation Celebration
ticket_classes.description:
Enjoy an EXCLUSIVE EVENING! Tuesday, March 17, 6-9 pm. Join Collin O'Mara, President and CEO of the NWF and be the first to stroll through this year’s wildly beautiful gardens and award winning floral designs—without the bustling crowds—and support the National Wildlife Federation—the most effective and largest wildlife organization
in America—and its work to protect wildlife, ensure healthy and sustainable habitats and connect people of all ages with the great outdoors. A Celebration ticket includes one free admission to any regular day of the show. (If you have already purchased a Show ticket, with this Opening Night ticket will earn a free Show companion ticket good for one free admission to any regular day of the show.)

ticket_classes.name: SPECIAL EVENT: AIFD Celebration of Flowers, Floral Design and Floral Fashion
ticket_classes.description: Friday, March 20, from 4-9 pm, join the elite designers of the American Institute of Floral Designers for an exciting evening of four floral design demonstrations and a fabulous Floral Fashion Extravaganza. This is your chance to meet up close and personal with AIFD Floral Luminaries: AIFD National President Tim Farrell, Joyce Mason-Monheim, the National Incoming AIFD President; Anthony Vigliotta, AIFD National Vice President; Kim Oldis, AIFD Nat’l Secretary/Regional President; and a rising star from Northern California, Philip Rice.  Come enjoy the fun, bask in the beauty and watch as the artists work their magic with hundreds of gorgeous California blooms.   (Note: This special event ticket is IN ADDITION to the cost of a Show ticket. A Show ticket is needed for entrance.)

ticket_classes.name: SPECIAL PHOTOBOTANIC WORKSHOP: Think Like a Camera (THURSDAY, MAR 19)
ticket_classes.description: HANDS-ON GARDEN PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP with Saxon Holt.  Following the free seminar "Think Like a Camera," step into the gardens with world-renowned photography expert Saxon Holt at your side. Bring along your camera and benefit from Saxon's years of experience with hints and tips to help you "Learn techniques of lines, shape, and focal points found in all good gardens to fill the frame with strong compositions." Thursday, March 19, 2015 at 5:00pm following Saxon's free 4:00pm talk on the "Going Wild" Stage in Expo Hall.  Limit 20 participants. (Note: This workshop fee is IN ADDITION to the cost of a Show ticket. A Show ticket is needed for entrance.)

ticket_classes.name: SPECIAL PHOTOBOTANIC WORKSHOP: An Artist's Eye in the Garden  (FRIDAY, MAR 20)
ticket_classes.description: HANDS-ON GARDEN PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP with Allan Mandell.  Following the free seminar "An Artist's Eye in the Garden," tour the gardens and floral displays with free-lance garden photographer Allan Mandall and take a look at flowers and gardens through the creative eye of a visual artist. Allan will present "three of the primary ingredients in his recipe for seeing" inspiring you to look with renewed creativity and vision. Friday, March 20, 2015 at 5:00pm following Allan's free 4:00pm talk on the "Going Wild" Stage in Expo Hall.  Limit 20 participants. (Note: This workshop fee is IN ADDITION to the cost of a Show ticket. A Show ticket is needed for entrance.)

ticket_classes.name: SPECIAL PHOTOBOTANIC WORKSHOP: The iPhone Gardener (SATURDAY, MAR 21)
ticket_classes.description: HANDS-ON GARDEN PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP with Dave Perry. Immediately following the free seminar "The iPhone Gardener'", accompany Seattle expert photographer Dave Perry into the gardens to practice on your own smart phone as he demonstrates the amazing potential these devices offer and helps you master their wonders while sidestepping some of their inherent pitfalls.  Saturday, March 21, 2014 at 11:30am following David's free 10:30am talk on the "Going Wild" Stage in Expo Hall.  Limit 20 participants.

name.text: Upland Sour Lottery | Pick Up 2-18 to 3-4
name.html: Upland Sour Lottery | Pick Up 2-18 to 3-4

description.text:
Thank you for visiting the Upland Sour Lottery site! The lottery will begin at 12pm EDT on January 29th and will remain open until 12pm EDT February 5th. Please do not try to enter more than once, as your entries will be canceled. 
For this lottery you are allowed to enter to win the following styles and quantities: 
Blueberry Lambic - 2 
Blackberry Lambic - 2 
Dantalion - 2 
VinoSynth White - 2  
VinoSynth Red - 2 
Please specify at the time of entry either the Brew Pub in Bloomington or the Indianapolis Tasting Room in Broad Ripple as your preferred pick-up location. Please take care in selecting your pick-up location, as it cannot be changed after your reservation has been made. 
Sour Brewery Tours: If you would like to pick up your bottle and take a tour of the Sour brewery in one trip, select Bloomington as your pickup location. Sour brewery tours hosted by head sour brewer, Caleb Staton, will be offered Saturday, February 28th at 3pm and 4pm. Tours will be limited to people who have a confirmed reservation. Email sours@uplandbeer.com to reserve a spot. 
Bottles may be picked up during the pickup period at the Bloomington Brew Pub 11am-midnight Monday through Thursday, 11am-1am Friday and Saturday, and noon to midnight Sunday, or at the Indianapolis Tasting Room 4pm-10pm Monday through Thursday and noon to midnight Friday and Saturday. Please note the Indianapolis Tasting Room cannot sell carryout on Sunday, in accordance with Indiana state law. 
Lottery winners will be randomly drawn and notified via email on Monday, February 9th, and can purchase the sour ale(s) they selected at their preferred pickup location from Wednesday, February 18th through Wednesday, March 4th. Each purchaser must present a government issued ID. If picking up by proxy, please bring your own ID and an original or photocopied State ID of the winner. The name on the ID must match the name in our records. Each bottle will cost $25 plus applicable sales tax. 
CONFIRMATION AND E-TICKETS FROM EVENTBRITE DO NOT CONFIRM YOU HAVE WON THE LOTTERY. You must receive a winning lottery confirmation via e-mail on February 9th.  In this e-mail you will be notified of which bottles you have won.

description.text: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.

description.text:
Tough Mudder events are hardcore obstacle courses designed to test your all around strength, stamina, mental grit and camaraderie. With the most innovative courses, over one million inspiring participants worldwide to date, and more than €500,000 raised for Help for Heroes, Tough Mudder is the premier adventure challenge series in the world.

About Us
FAQ
Contact Mudder Services
